It is often used with verbs to indicate the completion of an action throughout a specified area or period.æ—¶å€™ (shÃ­hou)This word refers to a specific point in time or a period of time during which something occurs. It is used to indicate the timing or occurrence of events.è¶Ÿ (tÃ ng)This word is a measure word used for trips, journeys, or rounds of actions. column5: ç©¶ç«Ÿ (jiÅ«jÃ¬ng)Means "after all" or "in the end". It is used to express a sense of finality or to seek the truth about something.ç¡®å® (quÃ¨shÃ­), åˆ°åº• (dÃ odÇ), ç»ˆäº (zhÅngyÃº)These words are synonyms for "after all" or "in the end", but each has its own specific usage. ç¡®å® (quÃ¨shÃ­) is used to affirm the truth or reality of something. åˆ°åº• (dÃ odÇ) is used to express a sense of seeking the truth or reality of a situation. ç»ˆäº (zhÅngyÃº) is used to indicate that something has finally happened or reached a certain state.For example, you can use ç©¶ç«Ÿ (jiÅ«jÃ¬ng) to say "What on earth happened?", but you would use ç¡®å® (quÃ¨shÃ­) to say "It is indeed true".
